title.rendered: Apply Now | University Of Waterloo Admission Requirements & Deadline

content.rendered:
The admissions seasons for the University of Waterloo are the Fall, Winter, and Spring intakes. The majority of the University of Waterloo programs have a one-year application deadline. The university has 42,000 students enrolled at this time, including 4,500 international students from 120 nations. International students make up about 22% of undergraduates and 37% of graduate students at the University of Waterloo.

The acceptance rate at the University of Waterloo is 53%, indicating a moderately selective admissions process. In 2024, the university had 38,166 full-time equivalent students enrolled. The majority of master’s courses are open to applicants with an academic grade point average of 75% and an IELTS band score of 6.5. For admission to the graduate programs at the University of Waterloo, applicants must have a GRE score of 300 or an equivalent GMAT score.

Admissions to Undergraduate Programs at the University of Waterloo

Multiple applications can be submitted simultaneously. International students have access to over 100 undergraduate programs at the University of Waterloo, giving them more options for traditional as well as career-oriented fields of study. The following are the admission requirements for the University of Waterloo:

Application Portal: OUAC
Application Processing Fee:  125 CAD (7,620 INR)
Admission Requirements:

  • Academic transcripts and results of Class X, XI, and XII
  • First or second division standing (minimum 50% and above)
  • IELTS score: 6.5 overall, 6.5 in writing and speaking, 6.0 in reading and listening or equivalent
  • Admission Information Form (Relevant jobs or awards if available)

Undergraduate Application Process: The step-by-step application process of the University of Waterloo is provided below:

  • Step 1: Select the program(s) of your choice
  • Step 2: Check the admission requirements
  • Step 3: Log in to the application portal
  • Step 4: Apply to the program & make arrangements to send transcripts to the university
  • Step 5: Send all supplementary documents

The University of Waterloo Graduate Admission

International students are eligible to apply for admission to nearly 200 graduate programs at the University of Waterloo. Prospective students must earn 75% overall and 75% in the final two years of their bachelor’s program in order to be admitted to the master’s programs offered by the University of Waterloo. The admission requirements for graduate programs at the University of Waterloo are as follows:

Application Portal: Online Graduate Studies Application
Application Fee: 125 CAD (7,680 INR)
Admission Requirements:

  • Academic transcripts with all courses, marks, and degrees
  • GPA of 75% or equivalent in the last 2 years of 4 year undergraduate program
  • Minimum GRE score of 300-310 or GMAT score of 550 and above
  • IELTS score of 7.0 overall, 6.5 in writing and speaking or equivalent
  • 2 academic LORs and professional LOR from a supervisor or senior-level employer
  • Resume
  • Writing sample
  • Portfolio
  • Sponsorship
